Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2015 12:30PM MaryBeary78 wrote: I had a 3D mammogram in August, showed clear but that I had extremely dense breasts. Routine lab work at GP showed numbers all over the place...high wbc, high rbc, low hemoglobin, low hematocrit, and others I can't recall. After a second one showed again rising wbc and other odd numbers he referred me to a Hematologist who tested for Leukemia.....she said there was nothing she could do. I requested due to family history that I be referred for a Breast MRI and had one on December 1 which found the first suspicious mass, and an ultrasound on the 10th confirmed that one and saw another....

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2015 10:45AM MaryBeary78 wrote: You sound exactly like me, with the symptoms that is....constant tiredness...(I used to run a minimum of 20-25 miles per week, if I get 3 in, I'm like wow).....I've had lymph nodes swollen in my neck since July 2014.....Mom has BC, sister has BC with mets to bones. 3D mammogram was clear in August, full blood work up all over the place.....referred for breast MRI December 1, with and without contrast....suspicious mass located in left breast......ultrasound confirmed that mass and another as irregular, hypoechoic 13mm and 11mm....biopsy on Christmas Eve ðŸŽ…ðŸŽ…. ...BI-RADS 4D.....highly suspicious? Anywhoo, definitely keep pushing to find out what is wrong! Sometimes Doctors miss things, like not feeling my masses during his breast exam......but if you keep being proactive, they will do what you want. Remember....Doctors work for you, ( my own Doc said that).

Posts.Content: MaryBeary78 wrote: I am 37, because of my history my doctor sent me for a mammogram in August. That came back clear, but with the notation of extremely dense breasts. Routine lab work around the same time showed my counts all over the place. Sent to Hematologist in September. Hematologist disregarded my request for BRCA testing, tested for Leukemia. No Leukemia but labs still all over the place. GP ordered a breast MRI and referral for BRCA test after having several bouts of cellulitis and other infections. Breast MRI December 2 showed suspicious irregular hypoechoic ovoid mass of 13mm, in left breast. Ultrasound last week confirms that and Radiologist said it was BI-RADS 4D. I go in for a core biopsy on Christmas Eve. The worst part of all of this is, having been sick for about a year and trying to get someone to believe me. Log in to post a reply
